dt: {bc}to deny the existence or truth of

dt.t: {it}negated{/it} and denied her own honest reactions

dt: {bc}to cause to be ineffective or invalid

dt.t: Alcohol can {wi}negate{/wi} the effects of some medicines.

pt: {sc}nullify{/sc} {sc}negate{/sc} {sc}annul{/sc} {sc}abrogate{/sc} {sc}invalidate{/sc} mean to deprive of effective or continued existence. {sc}nullify{/sc} implies counteracting completely the force, effectiveness, or value of something.
{sc}negate{/sc} implies the destruction or canceling out of each of two things by the other.
{sc}annul{/sc} suggests making ineffective or nonexistent often by legal or official action.
{sc}abrogate{/sc} is like {sc}annul{/sc} but more definitely implies a legal or official act.
{sc}invalidate{/sc} implies making something powerless or unacceptable by declaration of its logical or moral or legal unsoundness.

et: borrowed from Latin {it}negātus,{/it} past participle of {it}negāre{/it} "to say (with the negative of a conjoined clause), deny, withhold, say no," delocutive derivative of {it}nec{/it} "no, not" {ma}{mat|neglect:1|}{/ma}
shortdef: to deny the existence or truth of
to cause to be ineffective or invalid

dt: {bc}tending or serving to {d_link|negate|negate} oneself: such as
{bc}tending or serving to render itself ineffective or invalid

dt.t: The counterpart of the self-fulfilling prophecy is the {wi}self-negating{/wi} prophecy, in which a prediction brings about its opposite.

dt: {bc}tending or serving to negate or deny one's own wishes, needs, value, or importance

dt.t: There will be {wi}self-negating{/wi} thoughts that haunt those with depression. They may think they are unworthy, or that they are a failure, despite obvious signs of success.
Emma once worked {ldquo}in TV{rdquo} but is now in the {wi}self-negating{/wi} throes of early motherhood.
He [Joseph Cornell] was also devoted, to an alarmingly {wi}self-negating{/wi} degree, to his younger brother Robert, who suffered from a severe form of cerebral palsy.
And for some reason—inexperience? compassion? {wi}self-negating{/wi} politeness?—you're questioning your instincts.

shortdef: tending or serving to negate oneself: such as
tending or serving to render itself ineffective or invalid
tending or serving to negate or deny one's own wishes, needs, value, or importance
